meanings.definition: To arrange systematically or in a structured way.
meanings.sent1: I will organise my toys by color on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: She likes to organise her schedule for the week every Sunday.
meanings.sent3: The ants decided to organise a parade for the queen ant.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a well-organised library, with thoughts neatly categorized.
meanings.sent5: He could organise chaos into harmony with his meticulous planning.

meanings.sent1: Let's organise the team meeting for tomorrow afternoon.
meanings.sent2: The event planner will organise the details for the wedding.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels tried to organise a surprise party for the bear.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership skills allowed her to organise the project flawlessly.
meanings.sent5: He could organise a group of strangers into a unified team within minutes.

meanings.sent1: It is important to organise your thoughts before writing.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will organise the classroom for the new school year.
meanings.sent3: The penguins decided to organise a talent show on the ice.
meanings.sent4: Her words helped to organise the chaos into a clear plan of action.
meanings.sent5: He could organise any space into a functional and inviting environment.
